info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 21 at 1:34AM CDT by NWS Lake Charles
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Rapides, northwestern Evangeline, eastern Vernon and northeastern Allen Parishes through 215 AM CDT... At 134 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Hineston, moving south at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Glenmora, Elizabeth, Hineston, Pitkin, Lecompte, Lacamp, Clifton, Otis, Elmer, Leander, Sieper, Calcasieu, Forest Hill, Mcnary and Union Hill. This includes Interstate 49 between mile markers 65 and 67. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
